text:
Hi guys,
I want to let customer filter blog by my custom fields in website.
Hi Vesa could you DM me your ticket id?

(reposting it here)
Hi Folks,

So I tried using Single Sign On(okta) to access private content. I followed the steps as mentioned in <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account-settings/set-up-single-sign-on-sso-for-private-content> and I have my landing pages enabled with SSO. However, going to the page does not do a redirect to SSO it just shows the page as though it is available to public.
Am I missing any step?

Hey guys, any Zapier pros on here? Looking for a way to query a contact object property when setting up an action to update a deal object

1. Trigger - Contact property "Deal_id" changes. Example = 1234
2. Action - Update deal where contact property "Deal_id" is X (1234).
Just not too sure what query I can type in here to make that happen...
Think I might have gotten it. I retrieved the contact property Deal_id in the trigger part. Lets see if it works

I am trying to add a cookie policy banner to our web site. I set up the default one in HubSpot settings and completed all fields and hit publish, but it never pops up.

Do I have to include any code anywhere? Or does the tracking script also take care of inserting the javascript thats needed to make the banner?

Hi there, I’m looking to help out a customer.
They have three types of customer - customer type A,B and C. Customer type A always gets a 20% discount on everything they buy, B a 30% discount and C a 40% discount. I can create a custom property for this under the company record but wanted this discount to automatically show on the deals and quotes. Possible?

I’m wondering if when creating options in the fields section if there is a way to allow the content editor to pick multiple items from a hubDB table? I see I can include a hubdb table field but it only allows me to select a table not select multiple fields that would be living within the table. Is there a way to do what I want to without having to manually enter all options as repeated choices but rather pulling the data from the table and letting the content editor make selections that way?
It should be included. Here’s my “have you checked your pockets?“: Do you have an adblocker on? Does it do this in incognito?
you trying to do all of this in the HubSpot app? or looking for a custom solution?
